item.description:
Phoenix Art After Hours: Festival of Trees & Traditions

Festival of Trees & Traditions is December 2 , 5:30 - 9:00 pm

$8 / $3 for Phoenix Employees, Museum Members.
($3 fundraising fee included)

Kick off the holiday season at the opening of the Wadsworth’s annual Festival of Trees and Traditions and be amazed by the fanciful, fabulous, and romantic trees, wreaths and more, decorated by 200 creative artists and individuals from throughout the community

NICE!
Enjoy a sneak peak of the museum’s decorations and have the first opportunity to purchase your favorite tree or holiday decorations.

NAUGHTY!
DJ Jon Eastman spins your favorite holiday tunes and dance music.

NOSHING THROUGH THE TREES
Enjoy a small "bite" while you gaze at all the Holiday decorations.

STOCKING STUFFERS
Book signing with Judith Ivie, author of Drowning in Christmas, 6 - 8 pm

Decorate a t-shirt with your favorite holiday motif – our nod to ugly holiday sweaters!

FILM 8 pm
Love Actually
This comedy follows the love
lives of eight very different
couples in various interrelated
tales set during the frantic
month before Christmas.
2003. UK/USA. 130 min. Rated R.
Directed by Richard Curtis.
Starring: Emma Thompson, Colin

GALLERIES and THE MUSEUM SHOP OPEN TILL 8

Convenient parking available at the Front Street Garage, off Prospect Street, behind the museum.
http://www.wadswortha...
item.how_to_find_us: Look for other members in the lobby at 5:30 and head on in to the main function hall. I will be there by 6 and catch up with you, I will wear the bw scarf with piano keys.
item.name: Phoenix Art After Hours: Festival of Trees & Traditions
